intro: Lithospermum dichotomum, commonly known as the forked peppergrass, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and has a low, spreading growth habit. Its leaves are opposite and often divided, contributing to its distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds.
